DOC.HEAD: United States Has A Cold First Day Of Winter
DOC.TEXT: Winter left no doubt about its arrival Thursday as it continued to pour arctic air out of Canada, setting record low temperatures in at least 17 U.S. cities. Morning lows were colder than 20 degrees below zero from northwest upper Michigan through the Dakotas to northeastern Montana, and plunged more than 30 degrees below zero in western North Dakota and northeastern Montana. Strong northerly winds brought wind chill readings to as low as 80 degrees below zero. The latest northerly flow of air out of Canada and the arctic regions brought the coldest weather of the season to the north-central United States, where at least 17 cities reported new record low temperatures for the date Thursday morning. Montana, Havre, reported a record-setting low of 43 degrees below zero, breaking a 105-year-old record.Chicago set a new record with a minus 13, colder than in 1872, when the previous record of 12 below zero was set. Readings dipped below zero fom the northern and central High Plains to the upper Great Lakes, and the frigid air was ushered deep into the heart of Texas. Numerous record lows were likely to be established east of the Rockies by Friday night, and before the cold wave ends many parts of the country may experience their coldest night of record, the National Weather Service siad. Afternoon temperatures were below zero across the northern and central Plains region and the middle and upper Mississippi Valley, and the the subzero cold is entering the Great Lakes region. Afternoon readings were colder than 20 degrees below zero in the Dakotas and eastern Montana, with readings still near 40 degrees below zero in north- central Montana. Strong northerly winds produced squalls with heavy snow in the Great Lakes region. In western New York state, the town of Pulaski was buried under four feet of snow in one night. Two feet of snow was reported at Barnes Corners, N.Y. Snow generated by the cold front blew across much of the High Plains and parts of the central Rocky Mountain region, the Ohio Valley and the central Appalachian region in the afternoon. Sunny skies and seasonable temperatures prevailed across much of the West, with the Rocky Mountain range serving as kind of a protective barrier from the arctic invasion into the central and eastern United States.
